title: Can't surpress MissingDependency  error
body:
I might be using this wrong but I'm trying to supress this error:

```
ERROR: MissingDependency - tests/Unit/Social/GithubUserTest.php:22:49 - Carbon\Carbon depends on class or interface cake\chronos\chronosinterface that does not exist (see https://psalm.dev/157)
        $user = new GithubUser(['created_at' => Carbon::now()->subWeek()]);
```

It's thrown when I run psalm on the [Laravel.io codebase](https://github.com/laravelio/laravel.io) with the following config:

```cml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<psalm
    totallyTyped="false"
    errorLevel="7"
    resolveFromConfigFile="true"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns="https://getpsalm.org/schema/config"
    xsi:schemaLocation="https://getpsalm.org/schema/config vendor/vimeo/psalm/config.xsd"
>
    <projectFiles>
        <directory name="." />
        <ignoreFiles>
            <directory name="bootstrap" />
            <directory name="database/factories" />
            <directory name="storage" />
            <directory name="vendor" />
        </ignoreFiles>
    </projectFiles>
    <issueHandlers>
        <UndefinedClass>
            <errorLevel type="suppress">
                <referencedClass name="cake\chronos\chronosinterface" />
            </errorLevel>
        </UndefinedClass>
    </issueHandlers>
</psalm>
```

Notice that I'm trying to surpress in the `issueHandlers` part. The error itself is thrown because Chronos loads [this file](https://github.com/cakephp/chronos/blob/master/src/carbon_compat.php) which aliases a class and interface (which I don't want). Unfortunately there's no way around it.

Any idea why I can't surpress the error from above?
